search_results.snippet:
Rope splicing in ropework is the forming of a semi-permanent joint between two 
ropes or two parts of the same rope by partly untwisting and then interweaving 
their strands. Splices can be used to form a stopper at the end of a line, to form a 
loop or an eye in a rope, or for joining two ropes together.
